intro: Scorzoneroides montana subsp. illyrica, commonly known as the Illyrian mountain scorzoneroid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered with a fine pubescence, while the flowers are arranged in a terminal raceme. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
